answerText: selenium[10] Selenium can replace sulfur in cysteine to become selenocysteine because both sulfur and selenium belong to this family of elements, which all lack two valence electrons and like to form two bonds.
heading: DEES |2014 | Editors 2 | 1 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This element is found in CIGS solar cells along with copper, indium, and gallium.  [10] Name this element which can replace the sulfur atom in cysteine to form a heavier amino acid found in glutathione peroxidase.
